00055 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00056 
00057     /* Kernel mode side */
00058 
00059     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or
00060                                    &user->thread.esp).
00061                                    DONT MOVE THIS MEMBER,
00062                                    switch_to depends on it. */
00063 
00064     struct ia64_fpreg fpuenv[96]; /* FIXME FPU: check if alignment constraints
00065                                      are needed. */
00066     
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00070 
00071     /* User mode side */
00072 
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     struct ia64_fpreg *fpup;
00077 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00078 
00079 } xnarchtcb_t;

00083     ia64trapinfo_t ia64;
00084     unsigned trap;
00085 
00086 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;

00088 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)  ((fi)->trap)
00089 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)  ((fi)->ia64.isr)
00090 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)    ((fi)->ia64.regs->cr_iip)
00091 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00092 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi) ((fi)->trap == ADEOS_FPDIS_TRAP)
00093 /* The following predicate is guaranteed to be called over a regular
00094    Linux stack context. */
00095 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->trap == ADEOS_PF_TRAP)
00096 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!(current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) || \
00097                                  (fi)->trap != ADEOS_DEBUG_TRAP)

00102 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00103 
00104 {
00105     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00106         return vmalloc(bytes);
00107 
00108     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00109 }
00110 
00111 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00112 
00113 {
00114     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00115         vfree(chunk);
00116     else
00117         kfree(chunk);
00118 }

00120 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00121 
00122 {
00123 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00124     rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ, cpu_online_map);
00125 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00126     rthal_trigger_irq(RTHAL_HOST_TIMER_IRQ);
00127 #endif
00128 }

00136 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00137                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00138 {
00139     int err = rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00140     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00141     long long delta;
00142 
00143     if (err)
00144         return err;
00145 
00146     rthal_load_cpuid();
00147     delta = rthal_itm_next[cpuid] - ia64_get_itc();
00148     
00149     return delta < 0LL ? 0LL : xnarch_tsc_to_ns(delta);
00150 }
00151 
00152 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00153 
00154 {
00155     struct task_struct *fpu_owner
00156         = (struct task_struct *)ia64_get_kr(IA64_KR_FPU_OWNER);
00157     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00158 
00159     rthal_load_cpuid();
00160 
00161     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00162     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00163     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_root_host_task(cpuid);
00164     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00165     rootcb->fpup = fpu_owner ? fpu_owner->thread.fph : NULL;
00166 }
00167 
00168 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00169 {
00170     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00171 }
00172 
00173 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00174                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00175 {
00176     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00177     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00178 
00179     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00180 
00181     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00182         {
00183         /* We are switching to a user task different from the last
00184            preempted or running user task, so that we can use the
00185            Linux context switch routine. */
00186         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00187         struct task_struct *last;
00188 
00189         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00190 
00191         if (!inproc->mm)
00192             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00193 
00194         __switch_to(outproc, inproc, last);
00195         }
00196     else
00197         {
00198         /* Use our own light switch routine. */
00199         unsigned long gp;
00200 
00201         ia64_stop();
00202         gp = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_GP);
00203         ia64_stop();
00204         rthal_switch_context(out_tcb,in_tcb);
00205         ia64_stop();
00206         ia64_setreg(_IA64_REG_GP, gp);
00207         ia64_stop();
00208 
00209         /* fph will be enabled by xnarch_restore_fpu if needed, and
00210            returns the root thread in its usual mode. */
00211         ia64_fph_disable();
00212         }
00213 }
00214 
00215 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00216                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00217 {
00218     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00219 }
00220 
00221 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00222 
00223 {
00224     /* Empty */
00225 }
00226 
00227 #define fph2task(faddr)                                 \
00228     ((struct task_struct *)((char *) (faddr) -          \
00229                             (size_t) &((struct task_struct *) 0)->thread.fph[0]))
00230 
00231 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task) ((task)->thread.flags & IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID)
00232 
00233 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00234 
00235 {
00236     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00237     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00238        task. */
00239     ia64_fph_enable();
00240     __ia64_init_fpu();
00241     /* The mfh bit is automatically armed, since the init_fpu routine
00242        modifies the FPH registers. */
00243 
00244     if(task)
00245         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: setting the mfh bit in saved
00246           registers, xnarch_save_fpu will finish the work. Since tcb is the tcb
00247           of a shadow, no need to check: task == fph2task(tcb->fpup). */
00248         ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(task))->mfh = 1;
00249 }
00250 
00251 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00252 {
00253     unsigned long lpsr = ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_PSR);
00254     struct ia64_psr *current_psr = (struct ia64_psr *) &lpsr;
00255     
00256     if (current_psr->mfh)
00257         {
00258         if(tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00259             {
00260             struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00261             struct ia64_psr *psr = ia64_psr(ia64_task_regs(linux_fpu_owner));
00262 
00263             /* Keep the FPU save zone in sync with what Linux expects. */
00264             psr->mfh = 0;
00265             linux_fpu_owner->thread.flags |= IA64_THREAD_FPH_VALID;
00266             }
00267 
00268         ia64_fph_enable();
00269         __ia64_save_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00270         ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00271         ia64_srlz_d();
00272         }
00273 }
00274 
00275 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00276 
00277 {
00278     struct task_struct *linux_fpu_owner;
00279     int need_disabled_fph;
00280 
00281     if (tcb->user_task && tcb->fpup)
00282         {
00283         linux_fpu_owner = fph2task(tcb->fpup);
00284 
00285         if(!xnarch_fpu_init_p(linux_fpu_owner))
00286             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00287 
00288         /* Disable fph, if we are not switching back to the task which
00289            owns the FPU. */
00290         need_disabled_fph = linux_fpu_owner != tcb->user_task;
00291         }
00292     else
00293         need_disabled_fph = 0;
00294 
00295     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00296        user-space or kernel thread. */
00297     ia64_fph_enable();
00298     __ia64_load_fpu(tcb->fpup);
00299     ia64_rsm(IA64_PSR_MFH);
00300     ia64_srlz_d();
00301 
00302     if(need_disabled_fph)
00303         ia64_fph_disable();
00304 }
00305 
00306 
00307 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00308 {
00309     ia64_fph_enable();
00310 }
00311 
00312 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00313                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00314                                          const char *name)
00315 {
00316     tcb->user_task = current;
00317     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00318     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00319     tcb->fpup = current->thread.fph;
00320 }
00321 
00322 static void xnarch_thread_trampoline (struct xnthread *self,
00323                                       int imask,
00324                                       void(*entry)(void *),
00325                                       void *cookie)
00326 {
00327     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do ia64_fpu_enable() if needed. */
00328     ia64_fph_disable();
00329     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00330     rthal_local_irq_enable_hw();
00331     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00332     entry(cookie);
00333     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00334 }
00335 
00336 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00337                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00338                                        void *cookie,
00339                                        int imask,
00340                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00341                                        char *name)
00342 {
00343     unsigned long rbs,bspstore,child_stack,child_rbs,rbs_size;
00344     unsigned long stackbase = (unsigned long) tcb->stackbase;
00345     struct switch_stack *swstack;    
00346 
00347     tcb->esp = 0;
00348     
00349     /* the stack should have already been allocated */   
00350     rthal_prepare_stack(stackbase+KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00351 
00352     /* The value of esp is used as a marker to indicate whether we are
00353        initializing a new task or we are back from the context switch. */
00354 
00355     if (tcb->esp != 0)
00356         xnarch_thread_trampoline(thread, imask, entry, cookie);
00357 
00358     child_stack = stackbase + KERNEL_STACK_SIZE - IA64_SWITCH_STACK_SIZE;
00359     tcb->esp = child_stack;
00360     swstack = (struct switch_stack *)child_stack;
00361     bspstore = swstack->ar_bspstore;
00362 
00363     rbs = (ia64_getreg(_IA64_REG_SP) & ~(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE-1)) + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00364     child_rbs = stackbase + IA64_RBS_OFFSET;
00365     rbs_size = bspstore - rbs;
00366 
00367     memcpy((void *)child_rbs,(void *)rbs,rbs_size);
00368     swstack->ar_bspstore = child_rbs + rbs_size;
00369     tcb->esp -= 16 ;    /* Provide for the (bloody) scratch area... */
00370 }
00371 
00372 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00376 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00377 {
00378     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00379     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00380     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00381     tcb->fpup = tcb->fpuenv;
00382     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00383 }
00384 
00385 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */

00389 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00390                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00391                                            const char *name)
00392 {
00393     struct task_struct *task = current;
00394 
00395     tcb->user_task = task;
00396     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00397     tcb->esp = 0;
00398     tcb->espp = &task->thread.ksp;
00399     tcb->fpup = task->thread.fph;
00400 }

00402 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00403 
00404 {
00405     unsigned irq;
00406 
00407     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00408         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00409                              irq,
00410                              handler,
00411                              NULL,
00412                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00413 }
00414 
00415 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00416 
00417 {
00418     unsigned irq;
00419 
00420     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00421         {
00422         unsigned vector = __ia64_local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00423 
00424         switch (vector)
00425             {
00426 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00427             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00428             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00429             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00430 
00431                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00432                 continue;
00433 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00434 
00435             default:
00436 
00437                 rthal_lock_irq(adp,cpuid,irq);
00438             }
00439         }
00440 }
00441 
00442 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (adomain_t *adp, int cpuid)
00443 
00444 {
00445     unsigned irq;
00446 
00447     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00448         {
00449         unsigned vector = local_vector_to_irq(irq);
00450 
00451         switch (vector)
00452             {
00453 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00454             case ADEOS_CRITICAL_VECTOR:
00455             case IA64_IPI_RESCHEDULE:
00456             case IA64_IPI_VECTOR:
00457 
00458                 continue;
00459 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00460 
00461             default:
00462 
00463                 rthal_unlock_irq(adp,irq);
00464             }
00465         }
00466 }
00467 
00468 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */

00509 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00510 
00511 typedef struct xnarch_stack {
00512     struct xnarch_stack *next;
00513 } xnarch_stack_t;
00514 
00515 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00516 static xnlock_t xnarch_stacks_lock = XNARCH_LOCK_UNLOCKED;
00517 #endif
00518 static atomic_counter_t xnarch_allocated_stacks;
00519 
00520 static xnarch_stack_t xnarch_free_stacks_q;
00521 static atomic_counter_t xnarch_free_stacks_count;
00522 
00523 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00524 {
00525     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00526 
00527     fltinfo.trap = event;
00528     fltinfo.ia64 = *(ia64trapinfo_t *)data;
00529 
00530     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00531 }
00532 
00533 unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00534 
00535 {
00536 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00537     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY);
00538 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00539     /* Compute the time needed to program the ITM in aperiodic
00540        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. */
00541     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00542 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00543 }
00544 
00545 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00546 
00547 {
00548     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00549 
00550     if (!nktimerlat)
00551         return -ENODEV;
00552 
00553     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00554 
00555     return 0;
00556 }
00557 
00558 static inline void stacksq_push(xnarch_stack_t *q, xnarch_stack_t *stack)
00559 {
00560     stack->next = q->next;
00561     q->next = stack;
00562 }
00563 
00564 static inline xnarch_stack_t *stacksq_pop(xnarch_stack_t *q)
00565 {
00566     xnarch_stack_t *stack = q->next;
00567 
00568     if(stack)
00569         q->next = stack->next;
00570 
00571     return stack;
00572 }
00573 
00574 void *xnarch_alloc_stack(unsigned long stacksize)
00575 
00576 {
00577     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00578     spl_t s;
00579 
00580     if (stacksize > KERNEL_STACK_SIZE)
00581         return NULL;
00582 
00583     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain &&
00584         atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) <= CONFIG_RTAI_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00585         {
00586         stack = (xnarch_stack_t *)
00587             __get_free_pages(GFP_KERNEL,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00588 
00589         if(stack)
00590             atomic_inc(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00591 
00592         return stack;
00593         }
00594 
00595     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00596     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00597     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00598 
00599     if (stack)
00600         atomic_dec(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00601 
00602     return stack;
00603 }
00604 
00605 void xnarch_free_stack(void *block)
00606 
00607 {
00608     xnarch_stack_t *stack = (xnarch_stack_t *) block;
00609     spl_t s;
00610 
00611     if (!stack)
00612         return;
00613 
00614     if (rthal_current_domain == rthal_root_domain
00615         && atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) > CONFIG_RTAI_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00616         {
00617         atomic_dec(&xnarch_allocated_stacks);
00618             
00619         free_pages((unsigned long) block,KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00620 
00621         return ;
00622         }
00623 
00624     xnlock_get_irqsave(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00625     stacksq_push(&xnarch_free_stacks_q, stack);
00626     xnlock_put_irqrestore(&xnarch_stacks_lock, s);
00627     
00628     atomic_inc(&xnarch_free_stacks_count);
00629 }
00630 
00631 static int xnarch_stack_pool_init(void)
00632 
00633 {
00634     while (atomic_read(&xnarch_free_stacks_count) < CONFIG_RTAI_HW_IA64_STACK_POOL)
00635         {
00636         void *stack = xnarch_alloc_stack(KERNEL_STACK_SIZE);
00637 
00638         if(!stack)
00639             return -ENOMEM;
00640 
00641         xnarch_free_stack(stack);
00642         }
00643 
00644     return 0;
00645 }
00646 
00647 static void xnarch_stack_pool_destroy(void)
00648 
00649 {
00650     xnarch_stack_t *stack;
00651 
00652     stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00653 
00654     while (stack)
00655         {
00656         free_pages((unsigned long) stack, KERNEL_STACK_SIZE_ORDER);
00657         stack = stacksq_pop(&xnarch_free_stacks_q);
00658 
00659         if(atomic_dec_and_test(&xnarch_allocated_stacks))
00660             break;
00661         }
00662 
00663     if (atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks) != 0)
00664         xnarch_logwarn("leaked %u kernel threads stacks.\n",
00665                        atomic_read(&xnarch_allocated_stacks));
00666 
00667     if (xnarch_free_stacks_q.next)
00668         xnarch_logwarn("kernel threads stacks pool corrupted.\n");
00669 }
00670 
00671 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00672 
00673 {
00674     int err;
00675 
00676 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00677     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00678        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00679     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00680 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00681 
00682     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00683 
00684     if (err)
00685         return err;
00686 
00687     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00688 
00689     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00690         return -ENOSYS;
00691 
00692     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00693                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00694                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00695                          NULL,
00696                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00697 
00698     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00699 
00700 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00701     err = xnshadow_mount();
00702 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00703 
00704     if (err)
00705         goto release_trap;
00706 
00707     err = xnarch_stack_pool_init();
00708 
00709     if (!err)
00710         return 0;
00711 
00712 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00713     xnshadow_cleanup();
00714 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00715 
00716  release_trap:
00717     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00718     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00719 
00720     return err;
00721 }
00722 
00723 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00724 
00725 {
00726 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00727     xnshadow_cleanup();
00728 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00729     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00730     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00731     xnarch_stack_pool_destroy();
00732 }
00733 
00734 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00735 
00736 #ifdef __cplusplus
00737 }
00738 #endif
00739 
00740 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00741 
00742 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00743 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00744 
00745 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00746 
00747 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_IA64_SYSTEM_H */
